intro: Psoralea elegans, commonly known as the slender psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small annual herb that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually hairy. Its flowers are pale yellow to reddish-brown and are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Psoralea elegans is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, arid environments.
